metadata.Title: CVE-2022-30123 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A sequence injection vulnerability exists in Rack <2.0.9.1, <2.1.4.1 and <2.2.3.1 which could allow is a possible shell escape in the Lint and CommonLogger components of Rack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librack-ruby - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
librack-ruby1.8 - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
librack-ruby1.9.1 - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
ruby-rack - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ruby-rack package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4').
